The Ecology/Ecosystem Services Framings || Concluding observations
4.5 Concluding observations

The shift by IPBES away from an ecosystem services framing in favour
of a broader “nature’s contributions to people”
(NCP; for discussion, see Díaz et al. 2018, 2019; Faith 2018b)
reflected, in part, the need to better address global/regional
biodiversity values:

It has to be recognized that the concept of “nature’s
contributions to people” has evolved in a context where
challenges related to the loss of biodiversity are addressed and
assessed on global and regional levels. The implications of this
widening from the ecosystem service framework … is largely an
issue that remains to be explored. (IPBES 2018a)

The IPBES regional and global assessments (IPBES 2018b,c, 2019)
advanced this wider conceptual framework through the use of a measure
of biodiversity-as-variety, phylogenetic diversity, as an indicator of
the global status of the maintenance of options (see link to
“Phylogenetic diversity and IPBES” in Other Internet
Resources).
